intro: Spiradiclis yangchunensis, commonly known as the Yangchun spiradiclis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
